instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
i had a short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> i found it at <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> i removed and short was gone i replace <CHIP>U9080</CHIP> i get 19.5v 0.16a i notices  <CHIP>U8800</CHIP> getting hot no boot i tryed DFU but get era 
The operation couldn’t be completed. (AMRestoreErrorDomain error 6 - Failed to handle message type StatusMsg (Operation failed)) [AMRestoreErrorDomain – 0x6 (6)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Very likely dead NAND.
Did you check diode mode to ground at L9080/81?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: diode mode to ground at L9080/81? is 7.3ohms on both

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: As expected; at least one NAND is fried...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: is there anything i can do

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
in fact yes, I can program the nands if you have P13

[MEDIA=youtube]d1UtGpDciX8[/MEDIA]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
You can replace the NANDs with preprogrammed ones, removed from another board.
Or use P13 to program another, even new.
